org.numenta.nupic.util

Class AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.numenta.nupic.util.AbstractFlatMatrix<T>
      • org.numenta.nupic.util.AbstractSparseMatrix
        • org.numenta.nupic.util.AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Persistable, FlatMatrix, Matrix, SparseMatrix
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FastConnectionsMatrix, LowMemorySparseBinaryMatrix, SparseBinaryMatrix

    public abstract class AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix
extends AbstractSparseMatrix
implements Persistable
    Base class for matrices containing specifically binary (0 or 1) integer values
    Author:
    David Ray, Jose Luis Martin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix

        public AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix(int[] dimensions)
        Constructs a new AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix with the specified dimensions (defaults to row major ordering)
        Parameters:
        dimensions - each indexed value is a dimension size

      • AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix

        public AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix(int[] dimensions,
                                  boolean useColumnMajorOrdering)
        Constructs a new AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix with the specified dimensions, allowing the specification of column major ordering if desired. (defaults to row major ordering)
        Parameters:
        dimensions - each indexed value is a dimension size
        useColumnMajorOrdering - if true, indicates column first iteration, otherwise row first iteration is the default (if false).

    • Method Detail

      • getSlice

        public abstract java.lang.Object getSlice(int... coordinates)
        Returns the slice specified by the passed in coordinates. The array is returned as an object, therefore it is the caller's responsibility to cast the array to the appropriate dimensions.
        Parameters:
        coordinates - the coordinates which specify the returned array
        Returns:
        the array specified
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified coordinates address an actual value instead of the array holding it.

        public AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix or(AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix inputMatrix)

        Returns:

      • all

        public boolean all(AbstractSparseBinaryMatrix matrix)
        Returns true if the on bits of the specified matrix are matched by the on bits of this matrix. It is allowed that this matrix have more on bits than the specified matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix -
        Returns:
